and for other purposes.


BE 1t enacted By the Senate and House of Repre-
sentatires Of the United States of merca in Con.

OF any money in the Treasury not otherwise appro.

mo "a AN ACT to al'erhe time of holding the District


Cor' of the United States for the Southern District Of


Alabama, and for other purposes


Be itenactea by the Senate and House of Repre-
sentatiUes Of the United States of .anerica in Con-
sress assembled. That the Distric, Court of the
United States, for the Southern District Of Alabama
shall be holden in the city of Mobile, on the second
MONDAY 10 December instead Of Tie second Monday
in October and in addition to the term now directed
by Law to be holden on the FIRST Monday in May in
each and every year, and shall continue 80 long as
business may require.


Sec 9. ind be it further enacted. That the re-
cords and papers belonging to the Distric. Court
heretofore holden at the town Of Cahawba, in the
Southern District Of Alabama, except such as may
be necessary in any criminal prosecution pending
II the said Court, shall be transferred To, and be-
trict Court holden at Mobile. and all causes of ci.
vii nature pending in the District Court heretofore
holden at the said town Of Cahawba shall be trans
isrred to the District Court holden iB the city of
Mobile, and snail have day therein and be proceed
ed in to final judgment aud execution, in the
manner as II the said causes had originated in the
said Court holden At Mobile; and it shall be lawful
for the said iss, mentioned Gaur to issue execution
upon Judgment aer=tofore rendered in the Dis.
Efics yCourt hoder q Cshawha which said iudg-
ment shall not have been satisfied snd to issue wrs
of scire aciGs for the purpose Of re,vng any Judg
nent heretofore rendered by The District Court
holden at Cahawba, and to issue all other writs or
process which may Be necessary. according TO the
course OF judicial proceedings.


Sec. and be it further enacted. That all caus
es of criminal nature now pending in the District
Court holden at Cahawba, shall be proceeded in by


the said Court TO hnsl judgment, and to execution
Of .uch judgment or senteace as may be rendered
by the said Court, in the said causes; and that
Immediately thereafter, the records and papers in
the said causes shall be transferred to, and become
part Of the records and papers OF the District
Court holden al Mobile.


Approved, I'd March, 1897

mo. III AN ACT for the preservation of the Cumber


berland Road.


Be 1t enacted By the Senate and House of Repre-
sentntires Of the United States of amerca in Con-
gress assembled, That the sum Of thirty Thousand
dollars be, and is hereby, appropriated, for the
purpose Of repairing the public road from Cumber-
land to Wheeling, under the direction Of the P.esi
dent OF the United Sates to be paid out OF any money
in the Public Treasury not otherwise appropriated
Sec. 2. find be 1t further enacted. That the Pre-
sident OF the United States be- and he is hereby au
thorized to appoint some suitable person superin-
tend the repairs to be made on said Road, whose
compensation to be paid out Of the sum appropria-
ted by this act shall be fixed by the President Of the
United States.


Approved I'd March, 1897.

NO. 29l AN ACT to authorize the improving of GER


tain Harbors, the building Of Piers, and for other pur-
poses.


he it enacted by the Senate and House of Repre.
sentatires Of the United States Of .aerca IN Con-
gress assembled, That the following sums be, and
the same are hereby, respectively appropriated, to
be applied under the direction OF the President OF
The United States, to accomplish the objects here.
matter mentioned; that is to say:
For improving Hyannis Harbor, in the State Of
Massachusetts, sum not exceeding ten thousand
six hundred and fifty dollars
For building two piers at the mouth of Oswego
Harbor, in the State OF New York. thirty three
thousand three hundred and forty eight dollars and
sixty four cents; part Of which last mentioned
sum shall be expended until contract shall have
been made for completing said piers. agreeably TO
the plan proposed in report made under the act
Of the twentieth of May last; and for erecting a
pier by contract, at the mouth OF Dunkirk Harbor,
in the State OF New York, three thousand dollars /;
For improving cleveland Harbor, in the State
OF Ohio, ten thousand dollars;
| For improving the harbor at the mouth OF Pas
cagoola river, in the State Of Mississippi and for
removing the obstructons TO the navigation OF said
! river, eight thousand dollars;
| For removing distractions to the navigation OF
Saugatuck river, and protecting the Saugatuck
Harbor, by suitable work, to prevent the washing
Of the sand from Cedar Point, into said Harbor, a
sum not exceeding fifteen hundred dollars;
| For completing pier at the entrance Of la
Plaissnce bay, in the Territory Of Michigan, agree
ably TO the plan and estimate made under the act
OF the twentieth of May last, three thousand nine
hundred and seventy seven dollars and eighty -one
cents.


| For making a survey and examination to ascer-
tain the expediency and expense of constructing
piers 10 improve the Harbor OF Churches Cove, in
the town of Little Compton, in the State Of Rhode
Island, tive hundred dollars;
For making survey and examination to ascer
tain the expedency and expense of erecting pier
in Stonington Harbor, in the State of Connecticut,
two hundred dollars;


For deraying the expense Of an examination Of
the public piers at Port Penn, Marcus Hook, and
Fort Miff1in, in the River Delaware, in the States
OF Pennsylvania and Delaware, in order to deter
mine the expediency and expense OF repairing and
improving the same, one hundred dollars;


For a Survey Of the Colbert Shoals, in the Ten
nessce river, to ascertain the distractions, the prac
,cabty, the manner, and the expense of remov-
ing them, two hundred dollars.


For removing the distractions to the navigation
of the Kennebec river, in the State of Maine at
Loveioys Narrows, four thousand dollars no part
of which sum shall be expended until contract
shall have been made for removing said obstruc-
,ions agreeably to the plan proposed by the Eng-
necr employed tomske survey Of said Narrows.


For the erection OF Piers, placing beacons or
buoys, and removing distractions at, and near, the
entrance into the harbor Of Saco, in the State OF
Maine, sum not exceeding seven thousand dol
lars.


SEC. g. .and be it further enacted, That the
several sums hereby appropriated, shall be paid out
Of any money in the Treasury net otherwise ap-
proprated.


Approved Cd March, 1877,

mo. 2s j AN ACT giving further compensation to the


Captains and ubaltes Of the Army of the United States


in certain cases.


BE 1t snactedby the Senate and House Of Repressa-
tatres Of the United States Of america in Congress
assembled. That from and after the passing of this
act, each captain and subatern in the Army shall
be allowed one additional ration.


Sec. 2. find be 1t further enacted, That every
officer in the actual command Of company in the
Army of the United States, shall be entitled to re-
ceivc ten dollars per month additional pay as COM
pensation for his duties and responsibilities, with
respect to The clothing, arms, and aecoutrements OF
the company, viii list he shall be in the actual COM
msnd thereof: Provided. That no subaltern officer
who shall De in the performance OF any staff duty,
for which he receives an extra compensation, shall
be entitled TO the additional ration herein provided
for


Approved Cd March, 1897.


mo 26.1 AN ACT authorizing the completion and repair


of certain Roads the Territory Of Florida and for other
purposes.


Re it enacted by the Senate and House of Repre-
sentattves of the United States Of america in Con-
gress assembled, That the President Of the United
States be. and he is hereby, authorized to cause to
be opened and repaired, in the Territory OF Florida
a public road, known by the name OF the Kings
road, from the Georgia line, by ST. Augustine, to
New Smyrna


Sec. g. find be it further enacted, That the Pres
dent be- and he is hereby, authorized to employ
the troops Of the United States, stationed in Florida,
in such manner as he may think proper. 10 opening
and repairing such road /; and for delraying the cx-
penses thereof, the sum Of eleven thousand dollars
is hereby appropriated.


Sec s. .and be it further enacted, That the ad-
tonal sum Of FIVE thousand dollars be, and the same
is hereby, appropriated for the completion OF the
United S,ases' Military road from Pensacola to st.
Augustine, by the constr ruc,ion of bridge across
the ST. Sebasiaa's river. near St: Augustine; and
that the further sum Of six thousand dollars be, and

mo "a AN ACT to al'erhe time of holding the District


Cor' of the United States for the Southern District Of


Alabama, and for other purposes


Be itenactea by the Senate and House of Repre-
sentatiUes Of the United States of .anerica in Con-
sress assembled. That the Distric, Court of the
United States, for the Southern District Of Alabama
shall be holden in the city of Mobile, on the second
MONDAY 10 December instead Of Tie second Monday
in October and in addition to the term now directed
by Law to be holden on the FIRST Monday in May in
each and every year, and shall continue 80 long as
business may require.


Sec 9. ind be it further enacted. That the re-
cords and papers belonging to the Distric. Court
heretofore holden at the town Of Cahawba, in the
Southern District Of Alabama, except such as may
be necessary in any criminal prosecution pending
II the said Court, shall be transferred To, and be-
trict Court holden at Mobile. and all causes of ci.
vii nature pending in the District Court heretofore
holden at the said town Of Cahawba shall be trans
isrred to the District Court holden iB the city of
Mobile, and snail have day therein and be proceed
ed in to final judgment aud execution, in the
manner as II the said causes had originated in the
said Court holden At Mobile; and it shall be lawful
for the said iss, mentioned Gaur to issue execution
upon Judgment aer=tofore rendered in the Dis.
Efics yCourt hoder q Cshawha which said iudg-
ment shall not have been satisfied snd to issue wrs
of scire aciGs for the purpose Of re,vng any Judg
nent heretofore rendered by The District Court
holden at Cahawba, and to issue all other writs or
process which may Be necessary. according TO the
course OF judicial proceedings.


Sec. and be it further enacted. That all caus
es of criminal nature now pending in the District
Court holden at Cahawba, shall be proceeded in by


the said Court TO hnsl judgment, and to execution
Of .uch judgment or senteace as may be rendered
by the said Court, in the said causes; and that
Immediately thereafter, the records and papers in
the said causes shall be transferred to, and become
part Of the records and papers OF the District
Court holden al Mobile.


Approved, I'd March, 1897

mo. III AN ACT for the preservation of the Cumber
| berand Road.
full articles.article:
mo. III AN ACT for the preservation of the Cumber


berland Road.


Be 1t enacted By the Senate and House of Repre-
sentntires Of the United States of amerca in Con-
gress assembled, That the sum Of thirty Thousand
dollars be, and is hereby, appropriated, for the
purpose Of repairing the public road from Cumber-
land to Wheeling, under the direction Of the P.esi
dent OF the United Sates to be paid out OF any money
in the Public Treasury not otherwise appropriated
Sec. 2. find be 1t further enacted. That the Pre-
sident OF the United States be- and he is hereby au
thorized to appoint some suitable person superin-
tend the repairs to be made on said Road, whose
compensation to be paid out Of the sum appropria-
ted by this act shall be fixed by the President Of the
United States.


Approved I'd March, 1897.

NO. 29l AN ACT to authorize the improving of GER


tain Harbors, the building Of Piers, and for other pur-
poses.


he it enacted by the Senate and House of Repre.
sentatires Of the United States Of .aerca IN Con-
gress assembled, That the following sums be, and
the same are hereby, respectively appropriated, to
be applied under the direction OF the President OF
The United States, to accomplish the objects here.
matter mentioned; that is to say:
For improving Hyannis Harbor, in the State Of
Massachusetts, sum not exceeding ten thousand
six hundred and fifty dollars
For building two piers at the mouth of Oswego
Harbor, in the State OF New York. thirty three
thousand three hundred and forty eight dollars and
sixty four cents; part Of which last mentioned
sum shall be expended until contract shall have
been made for completing said piers. agreeably TO
the plan proposed in report made under the act
Of the twentieth of May last; and for erecting a
pier by contract, at the mouth OF Dunkirk Harbor,
in the State OF New York, three thousand dollars /;
For improving cleveland Harbor, in the State
OF Ohio, ten thousand dollars;
| For improving the harbor at the mouth OF Pas
cagoola river, in the State Of Mississippi and for
removing the obstructons TO the navigation OF said
! river, eight thousand dollars;
| For removing distractions to the navigation OF
Saugatuck river, and protecting the Saugatuck
Harbor, by suitable work, to prevent the washing
Of the sand from Cedar Point, into said Harbor, a
sum not exceeding fifteen hundred dollars;
| For completing pier at the entrance Of la
Plaissnce bay, in the Territory Of Michigan, agree
ably TO the plan and estimate made under the act
OF the twentieth of May last, three thousand nine
hundred and seventy seven dollars and eighty -one
cents.


| For making a survey and examination to ascer-
tain the expediency and expense of constructing
piers 10 improve the Harbor OF Churches Cove, in
the town of Little Compton, in the State Of Rhode
Island, tive hundred dollars;
For making survey and examination to ascer
tain the expedency and expense of erecting pier
in Stonington Harbor, in the State of Connecticut,
two hundred dollars;


For deraying the expense Of an examination Of
the public piers at Port Penn, Marcus Hook, and
Fort Miff1in, in the River Delaware, in the States
OF Pennsylvania and Delaware, in order to deter
mine the expediency and expense OF repairing and
improving the same, one hundred dollars;


For a Survey Of the Colbert Shoals, in the Ten
nessce river, to ascertain the distractions, the prac
,cabty, the manner, and the expense of remov-
ing them, two hundred dollars.


For removing the distractions to the navigation
of the Kennebec river, in the State of Maine at
Loveioys Narrows, four thousand dollars no part
of which sum shall be expended until contract
shall have been made for removing said obstruc-
,ions agreeably to the plan proposed by the Eng-
necr employed tomske survey Of said Narrows.


For the erection OF Piers, placing beacons or
buoys, and removing distractions at, and near, the
entrance into the harbor Of Saco, in the State OF
Maine, sum not exceeding seven thousand dol
lars.


SEC. g. .and be it further enacted, That the
several sums hereby appropriated, shall be paid out
Of any money in the Treasury net otherwise ap-
proprated.


Approved Cd March, 1877,

mo. 2s j AN ACT giving further compensation to the


Captains and ubaltes Of the Army of the United States


in certain cases.


BE 1t snactedby the Senate and House Of Repressa-
tatres Of the United States Of america in Congress
assembled. That from and after the passing of this
act, each captain and subatern in the Army shall
be allowed one additional ration.


Sec. 2. find be 1t further enacted, That every
officer in the actual command Of company in the
Army of the United States, shall be entitled to re-
ceivc ten dollars per month additional pay as COM
pensation for his duties and responsibilities, with
respect to The clothing, arms, and aecoutrements OF
the company, viii list he shall be in the actual COM
msnd thereof: Provided. That no subaltern officer
who shall De in the performance OF any staff duty,
for which he receives an extra compensation, shall
be entitled TO the additional ration herein provided
for


Approved Cd March, 1897.
